item.title: Stage orange observations amid COVID-19, my employers
item.description:
in Life Purpose, Career, Entrepreneurship

@bonesurfer You're in luck because chiro is a pretty Green field, so you should be able to find a Greener company without retraining.

In general, if you want Green+, avoid applying to giant companies. You want a smaller, more personal operation. I would never work for a giant company in any field. It's a meat-grinder and I want no part of it.

item.title: Ethical Passive Income
item.description:
in Life Purpose, Career, Entrepreneurship

@louhad Well, you could invest in companies which you feel are advancing mankind the most. Stage Green companies.

But you can't be too idealistic about it because all companies cause collateral damage. You can't run a large company without some exploitation of someone.

For example you could invest in Tesla if you think electric cars are good for mankind. But Tesla of course still exploits its workers.

One of the reasons I don't invest in stocks much any more is because its hard to find non-exploitative ones. I used to invest in oil companies and make a decent return, but can't bring myself to do that any more.

If you really don't want to exploit others, earn your money from your own creative labor, not investing.

item.title: Spiral Dynamics, Enlightenment, and Spirituality
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
16 hours ago, louhad said:

I think I have a pretty good idea of what spirituality looks like in the feminine stages(Purple, Blue, Green, Turquoise), but I am wondering what spirituality looks like in the masculine stages(red, orange, yellow).

It's not a good idea to classify entire stages as masculine or feminine. Masculine/feminine is a typology which cuts across all stages. Likewise, introvert/extrovert cuts across all stages.

See my video called Spiral Dynamics - Nuances

Quote

I am having trouble conceptualizing how a stage blue monk for example who is prejudice against gay people can realize oneness.Â 

That's exactly what most Eastern monks and yogis are like. Zen masters are famous for this kind of behavior. They can be very enlightened but sexist, racist, homophobic, nationalistic, etc. because the mind is still at stage Blue due to the culture it is steeped in.

Enlightenment will not rewire your entire mind and it will not deprogram it of all cultural biases and beliefs. That requires much more work.

Corruption always exists, there are many degrees of it, but it can be rooted out by electing effective higher consciousness leaders with managerial experience.

This is good leadership and good government. Without leadership like this you'd be living in a hellhole.

item.title: Mr Bill Gates - conscious stage green philanthropist OR dangerous, shady elitist?

in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
2 hours ago, LaucherJunge said:

@Leo Gura
My argument was about actual investigations. I am well aware that mindless accusations are problematic, but if there is a basis like being able to investigate all of the visitors of Epsteins island, what speaks against such an investigation and how is it that it hasn't been done?

By all means, let the FBI investigate crime.

How do you know they aren't investigating it?

And keep in mind, an investigation is only possible if there is good evidence. Tons of crime goes uninvestigated because the evidence is not strong enough. This doesn't mean it's a conspiracy. The FBI works very hard to nail criminals but it's difficult work.

item.title: the illusion of utopia equality or end of hierarchy
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
11 hours ago, The observer said:

i would love to hear more about this equality cuz i dont really see it in action. i believe r now less than 1% of ppl control more than 99% of the money and resources like extreme alpha chimps so hows that more equal?

In ancient Rome, 30-40% of the population were slaves.

When a neighboring city was conquered, all of its men would have their throats slit, all the women and children would be raped and sold as slaves. That's the true meaning of a war. Every citizen's life is on the line and they know it. If the wall is breached, everyone is fucked.

One of the biggest reasons men joined the army and went to war is that if they won, they got to rape all the women for free. For many this was their only chance for sex.

We've made some progress.

You live in so much luxury you have no idea what true inequality even means:

Â

item.title: Mr Bill Gates - conscious stage green philanthropist OR dangerous, shady elitist?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
5 minutes ago, Tobia said:

@Leo GuraÂ 

why did the goverment stopÂ  funding Hardvard studies on vaccine side effects and injuries?

Why is the there a specific Court for vaccine injury in which the damages are paid by taxpayers?

Despite its immensely high bar, us taxpayersÂ already paid $4.2 billion in damages to people damaged or killed by vaccines.

Why is there a specific act to remove ALL liability and responsibility of pharmaceutical companies in regards to vaccines?

Why italian scientists who found nanoparticles in them are being silenced and sometimes mysteriously killed?

These are not speculations, it's history

This is not a topic for this forum.

I'm not going to litigate all those points here.

Vaccines are a public needÂ and I'm not saying they don't have some side-effects. When you have small pox or Black Death, there's a cost to stopping it but theÂ cost of not stopping it is far worse.

item.title: Mr Bill Gates - conscious stage green philanthropist OR dangerous, shady elitist?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
8 minutes ago, LfcCharlie4 said:

@Leo Gura I respect your decision to not allow conspiracy theories here as it is your forum and will stop posting them and focus my time here on awakening and health/ fitness/ nutrition, are we allowed to post about 'alternative' health at least, and different methods of healing?Â 

Good. Thank you.

Alternative healing is fine as long as it's not somethingÂ harmful or wedded to a conspriacy theory.

Quote

I disagree with you regarding 'Conspiracy Theories' and am too not interested in many, just solely interested in the truth. Actually, you'll be surprised to know David Icke always talks about infinite awareness, infinite love, the nature of reality etc before any of the conspiracy stuff, hopefully he will get a lot of his readers interested in spirituality. He often talks about the solution being raising our consciousness and awakening, he even has done Psychedelics a few times

I am aware of his work.

David Icke is not Awake and he does not embody Love or the highest Truth.

He has some half-assedÂ understanding of how reality works, filtered through his own biases and lack of consciousness.

Just because he talksÂ about consciousness or love does not mean he really understands how theyÂ work.

I find his work to be corrupting the minds of people who should be focused on learning how to Love.

David Icke feedsÂ peoples'Â base fears. You are not going to awaken that way or becomeÂ a happy loving person.

20 minutes ago, Raphael said:

@Leo GuraÂ Damn... You annihilated my argumentation.

item.title: Mr Bill Gates - conscious stage green philanthropist OR dangerous, shady elitist?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
51 minutes ago, Raptorsin7 said:

@Leo Gura How do you transcend judgement?

By realizing you are everything you judge.

42 minutes ago, Tobia said:

You shouldn't want mandatory, forced vaccinationÂ under any circumstance. And that is 100% the direction we are heading. Bill Gates has been a huge proponent of that.

Actually that exactly what people want.

You seem to forget how the Black plague worked and how the Native Americans were killed off.

Your libertarian-like ideology will crumble in the face of serious survival challenges, as Covid-19 is showing. Society will not care about your ideals. Society will favor survival.

Quote

Whatever your belief about vaccines is and how poorly informed you might be, forcing someone to have an injection in their veins is fascism.

No it isn't. It's fundamental survival.

Without such measures you'd already be dead.

Quote

It's the ultimate form of control. It's the most brilliant business model ever, giving a drug to perfectly healthy people. Genius.

You will see your freedom and rights be stripped awayÂ from you in the name of safety and security.

Covid19 will pass soon, the control will not.

Covid will only pass because serious measures were taken.

Quote

After 9/11 manyÂ temporary uncostitutionalÂ programs began and they should've ended soon after. They are still going on today.

Again, you would sing a different tune if a terrorist boarded your plane.

You take so much forÂ granted. You treat terrorism as a theoretical matter rather than the reality that it is. If you don't protect people from terrorism they will kick you out of office.

(Not saying Patriot Act and NSA spying doesn't have excesses.)

Quote

In the meantime, the extreme lockdown measures will have destroyed the world economy and killed millions.

There cannot be an economy when half the population is sick and dying from lack of hospitals.

item.title: Does martial arts count as spiral dynamics stage red?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
1 hour ago, Raphael said:

However, from my understanding, there are also multiple aspects to this question. There's fear, but there's also what happens in the situation, a fearless person who surrendered everything can also get attacked. In this situation what should he do?

This question is still being asked from fear. You are looking for an answer at the level of survival while the real answer is at the level of metaphysics.

Have the courage to not feed this fear-based scenario.

Imagine instead that you are such a good person that no one wants to attack you. And if they do, you will be calm enough to endure it. And if they kill you, you will die happy.

After all, even if you are Connor McGregor, I can still just shoot you with a taser and slit your throat with zero training.

You can NEVER win the battle of securing yourself. That's what the wiseÂ understand. So they give up that fantasy.

The irony, as with guns, is thatÂ you are much more likely to get damaged by your martial training than getting attacked on the street while defenseless.

One bad flip or punch can give your brain damage or ruin your spine. And you will be doing thousands of themÂ in training.

Quote

An enlightened person can love its aggressor but at the same prevent him from killing him, at least from my perspective.

Yes

But you ain't there. We are trying to guide you there. You won't get there by being stuck in fear.

Going defenseless is a great spiritual practice. Is there risk? Of course. That's the point! You consciously bite thatÂ bullet.

item.title: Overcome existential fear?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
On 4/13/2020 at 7:49 AM, electroBeam said:

Next fear:

As the physical universe faded, and as sleep faded, as the mind entered deep sleep, the entire universe went to a void. A massive void. Much bigger than a typical zen void. I felt like I was going to a place, completely foreign, and would never ever come back to physical reality.Â The I was dying rapidly.Â 

Again its super scary because all of maya, rven beyond the physical, seems to dissolve, and there's a strong existential fear of not knowing if you will come back.

As that happened I pulled back into this dream. And went into my bed.

Yes, that's happened to me.

It's scary. No way around it.

Quote

I don't think these experiences are excuses to not do the practices. I'm sure you guys go through this on psychedelics. How to overcome such fears?

All fear is overcome with love.

Your love must be stronger than your fear.

It's okay if you don't fully surrender in one attempt. It may take hundreds of attempts.

item.title: Does martial arts count as spiral dynamics stage red?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
13 minutes ago, Kshantivadin said:

@Leo Gura

I can't stop laughing!!!!!!!

So what now? I still want to practice martial arts and to spar. My motivation for it has turned from self-defense and ego preservation and having a strong body and basing my ego off of being disciplined and resilient (when i was 15)Â  to doing it for beauty, beauty of a strong body, beauty of the range of motion and flexibility a strong body can do (look how beautiful the gymnastic movements are). Also, dueling is beautiful and I feel that it's going to propel me into deeper states of consciousness in the long run. My being craves for the ritualized death of a fight. I want to be put on the line and fight for my life. I also want to get beat, I haven't felt pain in a long time. I feel that getting beat up will allow me to start experiencing life more fully, like a reset on a faulty hardware. Fighting is an expression of my masculinity which I feel inside all of my pores and crave it. Ultimately, it's for consciousness and beauty, and it's out of love.

I don't consider it that low consciousness if you approach it in this Fight Club-esque fashion. Of course a machine elf wouldn't be doing any of that, but I'm human.

Yes there are higher things in life to do! I still can't meditate all day though. I am a guy with a strong masculine essence and martial arts are part of my physical training.

Do what you gotta do. Burn through whatever karma you feel you must burn through.

But you are not human.

I am not here to judge you. I'm just pointing out a higher possibility of who you can be. If you want to master punching creatures in the face, go for it. But try to understand why that looks silly from my POV.

What if you mastered love instead?

when its convenient forÂ you and sprinkle truisms in when you want.Â

item.title: President Obama talks COVID and endorses Biden
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
42 minutes ago, Free Mind said:

Do you think Joe is really as bad as people are making him seem? I find him to be a relatively reasonable moderate liberal.Â 

Well, it's all relative.

He's certain no Bernie. But then again, even if Bernie had won it's not like his progressive agenda would get fully implemented.

Society can only evolve at a modest rate. Which frustrates many progressives (myself included). But what can you do?

Biden is a vanilla status quo liberal. I don't think he's as bad as progressives paint him to be. Although like he said, "Nothing will fundamentally change." He will make moderate improvements on the edges. He will not fix deep structural issues.

36 minutes ago, DivineSoda said:

Democratically? Is that how you see our election processÂ @Leo Gura?

Democracy comes in many degrees.

Yes, we are a relative democracy.

Quote

Bernie is not my choice. None of them are.Â But even I could see, Bernie Sanders was clearlyÂ shafted in 2016 by the DNC and the mainstream media. The same thing happened this year. It was partly Bernie's fault with some poor tactics, but the manipulation was again clear.

Did you not pay attention in 2016? Do you not remember Project Veritas and all their revelations of shit that goes on behind the scenes? The Clinton Emails?Â Or how the super delegates declared Clinton the victor in states before the people even voted? Or is that conspiracy theory to you?Â 

Bernie wasn't shafted by the media in 2016. The media simply didn't take him seriously because there was no reason for them to expect Bernie to have any chance of winning. I didn't take Bernie seriously in 2016 because in 2016 Bernie was a nobody and a total long-shot. Bernie himself didn't seriously think he'd win. You are confusing the media's lack of vision for corruption, but these are very different things. Of course the media lacks progressive vision and they will not go all-in on an unknown candidate with an unproven ability to win. The media underestimated Trump for this reason too. They simply lack vision and deep analysis.

Yes, the DNC did some scheming against Bernie -- but again... that's not simply because they are evil but because they didn't think Bernie had a chance of winning. In a sense it would be irresponsible for them to allow a relative nobody to take the nomination away from a mega-celebrity like Clinton.

It's not a conspiracy theory, it's just ignorance about how politics works. Politics involves strategy and scheming. It's a Game of Thrones situation.

Quote

Our elections are not a democracy. Anyone who pays attention can see this:Â redistricting, gerrymandering, party insiders,Â super delegates, the electoral college, the DNC, super pacs, mainstream media manipulation, voting machine manipulation, the shitty debates, voter fraud, voter ID laws, on and on.Â 

This is not a democracy Leo. The system is corrupt, through and through. Besides that, our minds are so thoroughly brainwashed, you couldn't possibly claim that "We the people" made the majority choice. We don't even have free thought anymore, let alone a free democracy.Â 

Real eyes, realize, real lies.Â Â 

Again, there are many degrees of democracy.

Yes, there is plenty of corruption and plenty room for improvement. But it's a mistake to explain Bernie's loss in 2020 as a function of corruption. The reality is that he's too progressive for most Americans. He did not lose all those states due to corruption. Bernie is simply not viable in the South, and that's a large chunk of the country which you are discounting. Their votes also matter in a democracy.

32 minutes ago, whatishappeningtome said:

Do you think if Bernie had more awareness of Stage Yellow/Tier 2 dynamics he could have better promoted his progressive agenda?

I doubt it. You can't spin Bernie's agenda too much. That's part of his appeal is his clear and forthright agenda. Majority of people simply aren't ready for it. That's not Bernie's fault.

Quote

I saw Michael Brooks from The Majority Report commenting on how Bernie was still talking about hisÂ political revolution even when we was the frontrunner, when he should have shifted to trying to appeal more to the normie demorat base. What do you think?Â 

I think the "socialist" label hurts Bernie a lot.

It's especially stupid given that he's not really a socialist.

But he's been using that label for a long time. I don't see how he could have backpedaled on it and maintained his integrity.

One of the biggest things I would change about his campaign is to stop talking about socialism. We are not going to have socialism in America for at least 100 years, so forget about it. Socialism is a red herring here. Just talk about improving the system and people will be on board.

item.title: President Obama talks COVID and endorses Biden
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
4 hours ago, DivineSoda said:

All right! Let's go! Let's get excited for another lesser of the two evils! Our democracy is free and we have choices! ð

What are you complaining about? Bernie had a fair chance. He lost. Democratically. Which means not enough people voted for him.

That's free choice.

When you cry "free choice", be careful not to confuse that with "the choice I want". A democracy does not guarantee that your choice will be the majority's choice.

Nobody stole the election from Bernie. Simply not enough citizens agreed with Bernie's message. Because most American citizens are not progressive stage Green socialists.

Just because your fave candidate didn't win doesn't mean "lesser of two evils" is what's happening.

i guess also regardless of how developed the society is.. a huge chunk of the army has to be red blue b cuz that is a necessary component to protecting the country from outside stage red invaders.. also the police provides security against inside criminals so its necessary to have a healthy red in control

Military and police is mostly Blue. Although some Red in there for sure. Red people would gravitate towards such roles and it can be problematic when the military or police start acting out in Red fashion.

There was a story recently of how US Navy Seals reported one of their own Seals for basically torturing and killing civilians in Iraq because the dude was toxic Red. And Trump pardoned the guy and invited him to the White House! Because Trump doesn't see a problem with Red behavior as long as it's "our guys" doing it in the name of America.

A healthy stage Blue solider will be careful not to harm civilians or abuse his power.

item.title: The 5-MeO-DMT Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
26 minutes ago, How to be wise said:

@Leo Gura I have never taken psychedelics before. Are there any safety tips you would give us to not get caught buying them? Or is the chance of that very small if we use online methods?

I don't answer sourcing questions.

My advice is to be careful when it comes to all things psychedelic. Take extra precautions so you don't regret anything.

13 minutes ago, Free Mind said:

That sounds liberating.Â To be clear, youâre saying the come down period of detaching from that peak is worse than the fear of going through the death itself?Â 

People's reactions vary.

Peaks can definitely be terrifying at times. But you acclimate to it as your understanding grows.

Facing fear is the whole path in a nutshell.

Quote

What do you have to say about someone planning to have a first 5meo breakthrough? Is there anything to fear really?Â 

Just face it. Have positive expectations and let your passion for Truth and Love guide you.

Fear will defnitely happen before you reach Infinite Love. That can't be helped and it shouldn't matter.

All fear is delusion. But that doesn't mean you can't harm yourself in the relative domain of human life.

The thing you fear the most is Infinite Love.

item.title: Does martial arts count as spiral dynamics stage red?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
11 minutes ago, Free Mind said:

What about people who are genetically predisposed to certain gifts and abilities? I understand what youâre saying but I just canât imagine someone like Michael Jordan doing anything but play basketball. Sure, in the grand picture it looks shallow just throwing balls in baskets for several years but perhaps there is a larger purpose being servedÂ in these kinds of activities. I mean, look at Kobeâs impact.Â 

Reality is a tautology. It cannot be anything other than what it is.

It would delusional of me to judge or reject Michael Jordan, Connor McGregor, FloydÂ Mayweather, Adolf Hitler, or Osama bin Laden -- as I would be rejecting myself.

It is all Love.

But question is,Â what are you gonna do about it? Whatever you decide to do will be how reality must be and that will be Love. Because you are God creating yourself. There are no limits on your creation. You can create heaven or hell.

item.title: Does martial arts count as spiral dynamics stage red?

in Self-Actualization
6 minutes ago, brugluiz said:

Repressing your "violent" side is not healthy at all. You can integrate it or become reactive. It's your choice.

That's exactly right.

But now imagine being so conscious that you don't have a violent side.

Stage RedÂ isn't bad. It's just primitive, like a 1980s PC.

item.title: Does martial arts count as spiral dynamics stage red?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
8 minutes ago, neovox said:

Most of usÂ are apes! I get that! LOL. I'm working on being more, but I don't contest it.. I enjoy a bit of ape art.Â 

Well, at least you're honest about it

item.title: Does martial arts count as spiral dynamics stage red?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
9 hours ago, neovox said:

The reason is, competitive play and kinesthetic expression. Almost like an extremely hardcore and masculine form of dance. It can be brutal, there's no denying that. Reality is brutal. Competition can be brutal. Loving and brutal

Yes, brutal. Ape-like. That's was my only point. It is the behavior of an ape. You are turning apery into an artform! Lol

Contemplate deeper WHY fighting is a part of human culture at all. Where did you even get the idea that fighting ought to be mastered, or that it's noble? Why do you buy into this idea?

Imagine a civilization in which people flung shit at each other, but they turned it into a highly refined artform. They would smell and taste the shit like fine wine. Then they would perfect their flinging technique. They would get all acrobatic with it and teach their children to do it to instill discipline and other fine values. They would have shit flinging dojos and televise it on pay per view. They would have the world's biggest podcaster narrate the art of flinging shit in between tokes of DMT And their children would see all this and say, "Daddy, when I grow up, I want to the world's greatest shit flinger." And daddy would proudly say with a tear in his eye, "That's my boy!"

If you met a DMT machine elf, do you think that guy would be devoting thousands of hours to master fighting other living beings?

Can you see how absurd that notion is from a higher consciousness being's POV? It's as absurd as engineering nuclear weapons.

It's like if you invested thousands of hours collecting shoelaces. Nothing wrong with that, per se. But there are higher things to do in life, assuming you are conscious enough of course. If you have the consciousness of an ape, then mastering apery looks good to you.

in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

It's right under your nose. But you are too busy judging.

I dare you to Love!

I have spoken.

in Self-Actualization

Turquoise is not a premeditated choice. It's what you must become if you are conscious enough. Think of it as your destiny. There is no choice about being God and Love. That's what you are.

item.title: The 5-MeO-DMT Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
14 minutes ago, Thought Art said:

@Leo Gura Leo,

Have you known anyone to puke, or fall into a deep depression followed by 5Meo? Also are people highly vocal and loud during?

Puking will definitely happen if youÂ don't trip on an empty stomach. But I have not puked in over 100 trips because I observe proper protocol.

People fall into depression and have ego backlash for all sorts of reasons unrelated to 5-MeO-DMT. Any serious spiritual work can bring that about.

Yes, expect some ego backlash if you trip deep.

I have never been loud. Nor has anyone I've trip-sat. But of course some people will kick and scream.

For me it is tooÂ deep an experience for words. I trip mostly in silence.

item.title: Mr Bill Gates - conscious stage green philanthropist OR dangerous, shady elitist?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
6 hours ago, Tobia said:

Could he be a greedy psycopath in bed with Big Pharma or a power-hungry control freak disguised as spiral dynamics stage green philanthropist?

Lol

Look at your paranoia.

If Bill Gates wanted to be a power-hungry psychopath, he could easily do so given his resources, and his work and influence would look very different. He could easily be a tyrant or a James Bond villian.

But here is a guy who devoted the remainder ofÂ his life to helping mankind, and you call him a psychopath.Â That's like spitting in God's face.

You can question the capitalistÂ political system which under-taxes billionaires, but when a billionaire acts for the benefit of powerless people, don't bite his hand. People are not bad for being billionaires. It's how they use their money and power after they get it that matters.

Bill Gates warned about coronavirus some years ago. While you were at home watching Netflix andÂ jerking off, he was working hard to make sure your mom doesn't die of a pandemic. Yet he is the psychopath. Lol

If Bill Gates wanted to, he could have supermodels riding his dick 365 days of the year and feeding him grapes. Yet he works every day to help under-developed countries fight diseases. Think about that.

item.title: The 5-MeO-DMT Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
7 hours ago, Salvijus said:

This sounds all nice and good but isnt this just basic nonduality 101? I mean everything is an illusion is not a new teaching, it's pretty basic stuff.Â It's as old as spirituality. I doubt budhha was not aware of this.

Also I have a question, why are you not aware of the things that these great masters talk about like other realms, angels, demons, disembodied beings, celestial beings, different universes, different dimensions, past lives etc many more things that they speak of like 84th universe. Why are you not become aware of any of these things in your trips?

First of all, I have become aware of some of those things and so do others when they trip.

But more importantly, all of those things are still imaginary (since all form is imaginary).

Infinite Consciousness is higher than all those things.

Nonduality has many degrees to it. It all sounds the same but one's consciousness of it can go deeper and deeper.

what i find interesting is the many ppl who tried through out history to solve the problems of poverty and hierarchical structures of society and what amuses me is that no one of them so far succeeded in that mission despite dying hard for it.

If this was true, you'd be a slave right now living under a tyranical king. Or even more likely you'd be dead.

Equality comes in many, many degrees. 10,000 years of human history is nothing but a record ofÂ the successes of equality over inequality. See the big picture. Evolution moves towards greater unity and love.

item.title: Leo, what are your thoughts on the falling birth rates in the West?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
11 minutes ago, The Don said:

Goodness exists in the form of self-love which means that human life is sacred. Otherwise, human life wouldn't be possible.

People like Stalin and Hitler had no regard for human life. Then look at what happened. Unimaginable suffering.

The most important question we can ask is, how do we make people good?

This is very counter-intuitive but by trying to make people good you create evil.

Real goodness is not something you make. Real goodness is the surrender to whatever is. Whatever is, is Good. Not realizing this is theÂ cause of all suffering.

Human life is no more sacred than virus life. Watch your self-bias

item.title: Does the upper class benefit from socialized programs?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
18 hours ago, RendHeaven said:

You are correct, but the mother is very likely to fight the truth with everything she's got. If you told her upfront "hard work alone did not get you to where you are... you are taking your privileges for granted" I don't imagine that going so well.

Is there a way to coax her to that realization, perhaps with indirect words? Or is a harsh confrontation necessary? It's tough to tell.

Of course she will resist it. It would be a huge blow to her ego.

That's why I said, "get her to contemplate". She has to want to think through this topic rather than acting out an ideology. This requires an open mind and genuine desire for a deeper understanding.

Since she's in stage Blue/Orange, what she needs is all the stuff requiredÂ to advance to Green. See my SD videos for tips on how to advance from Orange to Green. It will take her about 5 years, assuming she is serious about growth. Which it sounds like she isn't, in which case, never.

Open her mind to the idea of growth.

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
10 minutes ago, WHO IS said:

I know this question might sound like the typical "Could God create rock that he himself could not lift", but Ill ask You anyways.Â 

If God is infinite consciousness could God kill/terminate/delete himself?Â 

God has "killed" itself when you were born. That's what you are: God not realizing it is God. Your human birth was God's termination of itself.

But this is only an imaginary termination of course. God cannot actually end itself because it is endless and exists in all places, so it has no place to go. Death/termination/birth is imagined by God. So God is prior to it.

Death is purely imaginary. Like in a video game. Can Mario ever die? How many lives does Mario have?

item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
43 minutes ago, Phil777 said:

What exactly do you mean by your childhood being imaginary? Like you didn't consciously experience it? That it never happened and it's just a backstory grounding your sense of reality? Because I am very certain I experienced everything previous to this moment. Childhood is not more or less imaginary than this moment right now and at one point in time had the same level of conscious experience and coherence like this moment. So, what do you mean by ones childhood being imaginary?

All memory is imagination.

You are imagining your childhood right now, which grounds your sense of self. Otherwise you would not know how you got here or what you are.

in Self-Actualization

You can buy small automated external drives whichÂ connect to your local network. Do some research. It's pretty easy to set up these days.

Or if you are cheap and lazy, cloud.

item.title: Does the upper class benefit from socialized programs?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

All this misses the point. The real point is to get your mother to contemplate what it would be like if she reincarnated and lived life as every member of society. So in the next life she will not be a successful business person but a poor immigrant with bad genetics, bad childhood, and a chronic disease.

Your mother's business success is not merely a function of hard work. That success is built on a foundation which your mother is not in control of: genetics, place of birth, parents, good health, favorable economic system, etc. She takes all that for granted by assuming that all people in society are like her. Well, they aren't. Not even close. Imagine if her child had an incurable lifelong disease which forced her into bankrupcy and homelessness.

That's exactly right, she is denying responsibility for being a member of society. It's to say that others aren't working hard enough when work comes easily to you and you benefit in a thousand other ways. Her success is the result of society. It is not her own.

item.title: Is space travel a waste of money?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

There is no difference between within and without. When you look up at the stars, you are looking at the face of God.

The budget for space exploration is tiny and it is better to spend it there than on more weapons of war.

item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@r0ckyreed Yes, empty awareness. You ain't ever gonna find a "thing" behind the eyes. All you will find is degrees of emptiness. And emptiness is not behind the eyes, it is equally in all places, since it is nowhere.

item.title: Leo,whats the best, most effective and fastest way to awaken?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@actualizing25 There is no clear answer. It depends a lot on you. It's a good idea to be open to exploring various methods to find those which resonate with you. Allow this to be a process of discovery and experimentation, that way you can stumble upon new stuff, new methods, new teachers, etc.

Psychedelics will give you some solid glimpses but they will not be enough by themselves to embody awakening. You will need some manual practices. Developing your concentration ability is crucial. It think this holdsÂ people back the most. They can't focus the mind long enough to awaken.

item.title: Exercises for discovering Nothingness, God, The Void
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@r0ckyreed In practice you ain't gonna awaken without psychedelics and/orÂ crazy concentration ability.

The point of meditation, contemplation, yoga, self-inquiry is to develop very strong concentration ability which is necessary to break through.

Concentration is the key. It changes your state of consciousness when done rigorously and for long periods of time. Psychedelics make concentration much easier. Otherwise you gonna have to train your ass off manually.

Questioning beliefs is good, but it won't be enough by itself. Your state of consciousness has to change.

item.title: Stage Yellow and starting college
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

What is it you want out of life?

We can't answer that for you. College is not going to solve any of your existential challenges.

item.title: Why Does Imagination Cause Truth
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
48 minutes ago, Javfly33 said:

By that perspective it could also happen that that One never remembers itself.

Since for Awakening to happen, the One has to imagine that Awakening happens . Why if it never does it?

Since there's no ground, also it can't be no defined end

Oh boy that is scary. What if I keep dreaming for eternity.

No, all imagination and division comes to an end sooner or later and ends in Oneness/Truth. Dreams are always temporary.

Awakening is not imagined. The dream is imagined. Awakening is beyond that.

item.title: Teach me methods to meditate all day.
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Endangered-EGOÂ If what you were looking for worked, meditation retreats wouldn't be a thing.

You are not going to be meditative all day long while doing everyday tasks without decades of serious training.

Either limit your meditation to short but rigorous daily sessions, or do a full 10 day retreat. Otherwise you will be half-assing it and get nowhere. Effective meditation requires rigor.

He spent decades building up to that point.

Lower your dose to 2g and CONTEMPLATE! It's not about quantity, it's about how you use it.

item.title: I am a bad person

Self-Love is the ultimate teaching.

item.title: LGBT acceptance and the world values survey
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
18 hours ago, Preety_India said:

Going by your wordsÂ 

"countries that are the most tolerant for LGBT people have the better living conditions, stable Democracies, etc..."Â 

If these countries are so tolerant, then why are black people still facing Institutional racism and discrimination?Â 

Not so tolerant huh!Â 

You are overlooking how relative this is.

There is far more racism and opression in less developed countries. A country doesn't need to be perfect to be developed. If you think the racism in the US is bad, you're overlooking how bad it is elsewhere.

Democracies are not dissolving, they are getting stronger via temporary struggle. The US is more democratic now than its ever been.

item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
14 hours ago, traveler said:

Is it even possible for god to accept itself completely? Is the complete acceptance absolute enlightenment?

When I contact myself as God, the depressing realization of infinite loneliness always leaves a void inside of me. There's such a hunger for Love and relationship, a complete clean slate, no knowing of what this is, no knowing that you are alone.Â 

God IS Love, so it already accepts itself as that. You justÂ require more consciousness of yourself as That.

You are only "alone" because you are ONEÂ with all things and others. Don't overlook that.

Do you have any insight to share on this topic?

You must dive deep into whatever color stage you areÂ still struggling with.

You can't be solid Green until you exhaust Orange. Become so Orange that you get sick of it. Then you will be truely ready for Green.

In a sense, that's what Elliot Hulse is doing. He's playing through Blue and Orange.Â Burning through his karma to someday reach Green. If he ever reaches Green in this lifetime he'll see how silly and dysfunctionalÂ his rants about sluts and sexual purity were. But he needs to go through these rants to purify himself. So what you're seeing in his videos is his growing up process.

The only problem is that he is dragging his followers along with him into the dysfunction. But he can't help it. So here we are.

item.title: Is Our Demand For Meat Responsible For COVID-19?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

You're not going to stop people from eating meat in our lifetime. It's too deeply embedded in our culture.

It is more practical to invent lab grown meat.

item.title: Extreme sensitivity to psychedelics
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Seems like you are still resisting and have surrender and integration work to do.

You can just lower your doses and keep integrating each trip until you stop being scared of them.

If there is fear, there is work left to do.

item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Cepzeu Â Very good. You hit the nail on the head there.

item.title: An Experience of Infinite Universal Love. April 5th 2020
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
5 hours ago, Anton Rogachevski said:

What are the implications of such an insight on one'sÂ life?

Hard to say. It is both epic and yet not much changes since everything remains what it was. You still have to take a shit the next day as long as you're surviving.
